nodeDataArray.description: Provides associated petroleum gas (APG). This type of gas used to be released as waste from oil drilling, but is now commonly captured for processing.
nodeDataArray.caption: Offshore oil well

nodeDataArray.description: APG processing turns associated petrolium gas into natural gas liquids (NGLs) and stable natural gas (SGN).
nodeDataArray.caption: Natural gas plant

nodeDataArray.description: Natural gas liquids are separated into individual hydrocarbons like propane and butanes, hydrocarbon mixtures (naphtha) and liquefied petroleum gases (LPGs).
nodeDataArray.caption: Gas Plant

nodeDataArray.description: Liquefied petroleum gases (LPGs) are transformed into Ethylene, propylene, benzene, and other by-products.
nodeDataArray.caption: Pyrolysis plant

nodeDataArray.description: Ethylene and propylene (monomers) are processed into end products using various methods (polymerization).
nodeDataArray.caption: Plastics engineering-Polymer products

nodeDataArray.description: Polymerization produces PET, glycols, alcohols, expandable polystyrene, acrylates, BOPP-films and geosynthetics.
nodeDataArray.caption: Lego Color Bricks

nodeDataArray.description: Polymerization produces commodity and specialty rubbers and thermoplastic elastomers.
nodeDataArray.caption: Sheet of synthetic rubber coming off the rolling mill at the plant of Goodrich

nodeDataArray.description: Produced Ethylene, Propylene, Butenes, Benzene, and other by-products.
nodeDataArray.caption: Propylene Containers

nodeDataArray.description: Propane, butane, and other general purpose fuels and byproducts.
nodeDataArray.caption: Liquid Petroleum Gas Truck

nodeDataArray.description: Used for heating, cooking, and electricity generation
nodeDataArray.caption: Natural Gas Flame
